title: @Riot Are we going to get the other 4 Darkins?
body: Im just curious, Because Aatrox is the only known darkin and his lore says he is one of five so are we going to get the the other 4 as well at some point in the game? i mean honestly, Aatrox probably misses his brothers/sisters

Who would be the 5th Darkin though?

Kindred could very easily count as two, or it could be Pestilence. Classically, the Four horsemen were Conquest, War, Famine, and Death, but today Conquest is usually replaced with Pestilence in pop culture, even though it makes no theological sense. 

_And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying," Come and see." And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer (Revelations 6:1-2, King James version.)_ 

The first horsemen generally interpreted as a false religion or dogma and/or false but charismatic prophet sweeping across the world, championed by the public. Many of the descriptions of him partially match the description of Jesus in the final days (Like he wears a crown granted to him, rather than the many crowns taken by Jesus a bit further in Revelations.) Because of this it's often assumed referencing the anti-Christ.

This doesn't fit with Pestilence at all, and all historical (pre-1900's) references to disease among the four refers to the fourth, or all four non-specifically. 

So yes, there's more or less 5 horsemen of the apocalypse in modern culture.

Vladimir strikes me as a Darkin. Not Vladimir himself, but the power that transfers itself from one host to another as we've seen in his lore. We have no idea how long that parasitic power has been moving from host to host, or its origin. 

From Aatrox, we've seen that his sword absorbs the life energies of others, while also sacrificing Aatrox's own life force to deal more damage. Vladimir's kit seems like a more primitive version of a Darkin sword. 
I reckon it'd be a nice plot twist for a Darkin blade to be sentient, and that the power that possessed Vladimir was a Darkin 'blade' that was broken and freed, looking for a vessel to carry it.
